column4: Hello. Is there a 'pain free' way of moving from Debian Etch to Ubuntu (or Kubuntu)
because of some package diffrences, it could be quite difficult.. and the livecd method will erase you data...
the best method is to backup your data, delete everything from a fresh install from a livecd and put your stuff pack
do you have a seperate /home paritions?
nope, so its going to be painful. I hate having to get out the backup hd is all.
there is one other way.. but its more painfull
we might have diffrent ideas of painful, what ya got
in hte live cd, resize your partions, add a /home partition, transfer data, then install... that would transfer youre /home data without using a backup disk
but unless you *really* dont want to get out your backup disk... thats probably harder...
well the issue is that the backups are miles away (and its a holiday weekend here). Maybe ill just wait till next week, im getting a 1tb usb backpack drive for the laptop
hehe, i want a TB usb drive, im still on a 512... yeah, think your best route it is to wait...
realy? cool, i will have to look at that, anyways, we are ot....
it does, but sometimes, computers choose not to obey the bootloader
and since a 1TB USB is newer, its more likly to have troubles with the bios
I wont be using the TB for booting, its for media storage for the laptop when I travel.
then it should work if your comptuer supports it... i have used alot of bootable distros, they generally work great, then you will have one or two computers, that choose not to read it...
thats fine, it will just be used on this box (I realy should nuke everything on this one anyhow, my storage method broke down and ive junk all over including 2 ntfs drives)
